texts.en:
Artur is a young farmer from Ararat town in the Ararat region.  Artur lives with his parents. He works at a local factory and is also involved in agriculture: he breeds cows. 

Artur has land where he grows grass and uses it as forage for the cows. Unfortunately, the grass gathered this year is not enough to feed the cattle during winter, so Artur has applied for this loan to purchase more grass for his cattle. He also plans to purchase 2 cows, which will allow him to incease his agricultural income and invest in expansion of the farm.

loans.use: buy 2 cows and cattle feed

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq is a 36-year-old married man who has 2 family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy foodstuff to resell.  He would like to open a big supermarket. In the future, he hopes to increase his family income.

loans.use: buy foodstuff to resell

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is a 47-year-old married woman who has been in the clothing sales business for the last three years on a small scale. She has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of clothes she has by adding a new autumn collection.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Noeline

texts.en:
Noeline lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (old parents). 

Noeline operates a beauty salon at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works six days a week.  

Noeline has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves and hair sprays. Her major business challenges are the ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a stand alone dryer and chairs so as to serve her customers better. 

Noeline lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: buy supplies for her hair salon

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a 49-year-old conservative mother.  She asked her daughter Noor to appear in the photo instead.

Sumaya has two sons and a daughter.  Her eldest is Noor, a 20-year-old university student. Sumaya has applied for this loan to support her daughter in her registration and semester fees.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is 32 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Magret has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Magret has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Magret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Magret hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her shop to a wholesale shop. 

Magret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Magret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 56 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su hija quien le ayuda en su actividad, su negocio es venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años en su casa de habitación. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto de fácil acceso, ya que esta en el centro de su comunidad donde vive.
Doña Juana el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, cal, leña etc. el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas se incrementen, ya que comprara bastante producto para contrarrestar la demanda que le hace sus clientes a diario.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Juana es seguir creciendo en su actividad comercial, y comprar una  maquina para la elaboración de tortillas al mismo tiempo generarse buenos ingresos para tener  una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Señora Juana is 56 years old. She lives in the southern part of Honduras. Her daughter lives with her and helps her in her business. Her business is selling tortillas, an activity she has been doing for 8 years in her house. Her business is located at a point of easy access, since it is in the center of the community where she lives.

Doña Juana needs the loan to buy corn, lime, firewood, etc. The impact that she expects from the loan is that her sales will increase, since she will buy enough products to meet the daily demands of her customers.

Doña Juana's plans for the future are to continue growing in her business and to buy a machine for making tortillas, and at the same time to generate good  income to have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras, September 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 46 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo Ambrosio y sus 5 hijos, todos ellos estudiantes. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron desde hace 12 años. Desde hace  más de 15 años  se dedica a las labores agrícolas  en sus terrenos de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa que le sirve de alimento para sus animales así como también para venta. Sus labores lo realizan gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos. Todos los días vende sus sembríos a las diferentes ciudades del país, “mis principales compradores son los comerciantes de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad donde vivo”, afirma. Comenta que en este mes le fue muy bien en el negocio, obtuvo buenas ganancias, por esa razón desea seguir sembrando. Comenta que ahora tiene cultivos de alverja, habas, maíz y demás hortalizas que muy pronto cosechará y mandará a la capital del país, pues es ahí donde tiene mayores compradores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya 2000” y este es el crédito número 17 con MFP, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Isabel, invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus sembríos de alfalfa, además de semilla de las mismas para aumentar la producción.
texts.en: Isabel, age 46, is a cheerful woman. She lives together with her husband Ambrosio and their 5 children, who are all students. Together they live in a house that they bought 12 years ago. For more than 15 years, Isabel has dedicated herself to agricultural work on her fields where she grows alfalfa. This serves as feed for her animals as well as for sale. She carries out her work thanks to the support of her husband and children. Every day, she sells her crops to the various cities of the country; "my main buyers are the businesspeople of the various markets of the city where I live," she affirms. She comments that in this month, her business was going very well for her, she obtained good earnings, and for this reason she wants to continue planting. She reports that she now has crops of peas, beans, corn and other vegetables which she will soon harvest and send to the country's capital, since there she has larger buyers. She belongs to the "Sicaya 2000” communal bank, and this is loan number 17 with MFP. She feels happy because in this time she was able to obtain good earnings, all thanks to the economic support provided to her. For this reason she promises to make her payments on schedule. She also likes working with her communal bank, whose members are hard-working people with a sense of solidarity. Isabel will invest the funds in buying natural fertilizers to improve her alfalfa crops, in addition to seeds of the same crop to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Vanesa, ella tiene  29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, la socia trabaja como administrativa en una universidad de la ciudad y aprovecha las relaciones publicas para vender productos de belleza y lencería para damas.
Vanesa es una joven madre muy trabajadora, que busca siempre como incrementar sus ingresos económicos para ofrecerles una mejor vida a los suyos, por ello está solicitando el préstamo, para comprar cosméticos, perfumería y lencería para sus clientes que en su mayoría son damas y además para capitalizar su actividad para la próxima campaña navideña.  Vanesa está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla con su actividad complementaria y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member is Vanessa, 29 years old.  She is married and has two small children.  She works as an administrative assistant in a university in the city and takes advantage of her relations with the public to sell beauty products and lingerie.

Vanesa is a young, very hard-working mother that always looks for ways to increase her income to offer themselves a better life.  For this she is requesting a loan to  buy cosmetics, perfume and lingerie for her clients, who are primarily women, and also to capitalize on her business for the next Christmas season.  

Vanessa is very thankful for Kiva's help with her additional business and promises to pay her quotas punctually.  She belongs to the communal bank "Gran Renovación" of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume and lingerie

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en: Gurgen is involved in beekeeping. He started beekeeping nine years ago and keeps 15 colonies of bees at present. Gurgen would like to purchase 10 more colonies of bees, as well as hives for them. Gurgen also wants to purchase medicine to fight against diseases. Development of beekeeping is important for Gurgen to earn more income and invest in further expansion of his farm.

loans.use: to buy 10 colonies of bees, hives for the bees and medicine

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a single lady aged 28 years old. She takes care of three children aged 12, seven and one year old. She sells water to residents in Narok town as well as operating a small kiosk. She has been running the business for three and a half years earning a monthly income of KES 24,000.

She has borrowed a first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD with which she intends to construct another water tank. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for the children that she supports.

Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to construct another water tank.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Elizabeth is married, and blessed with three children, ages 10, eight and three years old. She runs a restaurant, a business she started three years ago; she earns a monthly income of KES. 7,200. 

She has requested for a fourth loan of KES.70,000 to purchase maize and beans for use in her restaurant business. 

The profit earned from the business will aid her in educating her children. Her dream is to see her children well-educated, and to grow her business into a renowned restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for use in her restaurant business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 33 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Regina has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing, sells cosmetics and hair oils. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shelves and also cosmetics and hair oils, and will help Regina to generate greater profits and boost her income leading to better standards of living. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to provide the best quality salon services and products in Lyantonde. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Regina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shelves and also cosmetics and hair oils

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 43-year-old conservative woman. She asked her daughter Ekhlas to take her place in the photo. Amal’s husband works in a government entity to support the family while Amal takes care of the kids at home. Now their daughter Ekhlas has registered in the university to study accounting. Amal has applied for this loan now to pay for her daughter's semester fees so she can continue studying and get her BA degree.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 29-year-old conservative woman so her husband appears in the photo instead.
Iman has four kids to take care of with her husband who works at a governmental entity. To help in paying some of the household bills, Iman has opened a mini market to sell some food products and other goods to the neighborhood. She has applied for this loan to bring more food products and goods to the store especially snacks since school is starting and a lot of kids go by the market to get their snacks.

loans.use: to bring more food products to the store

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 41-year-old conservative woman. She asked her father to take her place in the photo. 

Hanan is a married woman and a mother of one baby girl. Her husband works in the security and safety business. Hanan has a sewing machine at home that she uses to do her small home business in tailoring and embroidery. She has applied for this loan to buy another sewing machine and more thread to increase her productivity in making embroidered traditional dresses. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open a small workshop and employ a few female tailors to increase the profits and start a distribution business.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and more thread

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 20-year-old single guy living with his family of eight members. Ahmad is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems. He wants to work in the banking field after graduation. Now he has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees so he can graduate as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has been running a vegetable stall for ten months.

Daniel learned about Milango through a friend with the aim of obtaining credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the fluctuating market because of the seasonal business climate.

Daniel is applying for a loan of KES 21,050  to build a structure to preserve his stock and minimize theft. The extra income from the loan will be used to increase stock. His dream is to own a clothes boutique.

loans.use: To build a structure to preserve his stock and minimize theft.

loans.name: Nenca Eliaba

texts.en:
Nenca is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba.  She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 10, who all go to school.

Nenca runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years.  She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase onions, tomatoes, beans, and many other items.  She has no other income besides this business. Nenca would like to expand her business in 5 years.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Nenca says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as beans, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Joice Awate

texts.en:
Joice  is a 38 year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 13, all of whom go to school.

Joice runs a general store, and has been in business for five years. She has no employees.  She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients, and is seeking a loan of 1500 SDG so she can purchase cowpeas, beans, onions, and other items for her store.   She has no other source of income. 

In five years Joice would like to expand her business.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Joice says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like beans, onions, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Justino Elijiah

texts.en:
Justino is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 9. One of them goes to school. Justino runs a general store and has been in business for three years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking out a loan of 4000 Sudanese pounds to purchase groundnuts and many other things. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Justino would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices. Justino says he is happy for the loans from Finance Sudan provided with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a retail shop – a business that he has been operating for one year. He started the business with his personal savings. His main challenge is price fluctuations and inflation.

Geoffrey learnt about Milango from friends who invited him to a group. He joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Geoffrey is applying for a loan of 73,100 Kenya shillings to buy cooking oil and sugar wholesale. The extra income from this loan will be added to his savings to start another business. His future plan is to open a wholesale for the business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and sugar wholesale.

loans.name: Nzembi

texts.en:
Nzembi lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is the married mother of six children, three of whom attend school. She owns a retail shop that she has been operating for six years.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and lack of funds. 

Nzembi is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, wheat and maize flour, and cereals. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and also provide a good form of education to her children. Her dream is to expand and open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat and maize flour, and cereals.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 34 year old farmer from Litein area in Kenya. He is married and has one child who is school. He produces milk and tea to sell to the people in the local market in his area; he also earns extra income from his boda boda business.

Kenneth is requesting for 20,000 thousand KES from Juhudi kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and also buy a chuff cutter. He says this will boost his living standards and hopes to buy a new motorbike in future to expound in his business.

Keneth however feels competition and lack of ready market are some of the challenges he is facing.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to support his milk and tea business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 30 years old and lives in the town of Matuga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, of whom one is currently in school. For the past three years Lydia has been working hard to manage her supermarket where she sells sugar, milk, soap, cooking oil and rice. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essentials like sugar, soap, soda and milk for the supermarket for resale. It also will help Lydia to generate greater profits and improve from her profits. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another supermarket in a different center. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lydia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essentials like sugar, soap, soda and milk for her supermarket

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Arturo y 3 de sus 5 hijos: Patricia, Teresa y Piero, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 27 años. Tiene 18 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales y en el cultivo de la papa, zanahoria, maíz y alfalfa que le sirve para incrementar sus ganancias, toda su familia participa activamente  en  las actividades que consideran familiares, es por eso que en las mañanas salen a  llevar a sus animales a pastorear al campo y en su casa también las alimenta con la alfalfa que  extrae de sus terrenos cultivados, después de varios meses vende  a sus animales que  son toros en su mayoría , ya sea vivos o vendiendo su carne donde tiene mas ganancias, otra forma de generar ganancias es  arrendando sus toros para el arado es por eso que anhela para más adelante tener más cabezas de ganado. Por ahora se concentra en la siembra pues ya tiene pedidos para la capital del país. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya 2000” y este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Francisca, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10 latas de semilla de zanahoria y si el dinero le alcanza comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Francisca, who is 49 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, Arturo, and three of their five children: Patricia, Teresa, and Piero, whom she cares for in the house that she inherited 27 years ago. She has 18 years of experience in raising animals and in growing potatoes, carrots, corn, and alfalfa, which serve to increase her earnings. All her family participates actively in these activities, which are considered family businesses. It is for this reason that in the mornings she goes out to take her animals to graze in the fields, and at her house she also feeds them the alfalfa that she gets from her cultivated land. After a number of months she sells her animals, the majority of which are bulls, either alive or butchered, from which she gets more earnings. Another way she has to generate income is renting out her bulls for plowing. It is for this reason that she aspires in the future to have more head of cattle. For now she is concentrating on planting, since she already has orders to send to the capital of the country. She belongs to the communal bank "Sicaya 2000," and this is her 10th loan from MFP. She feels happy since during this time she succeeded in obtaining good earnings, all thanks to the economic help that they offered her. For this reason she promises to make her payments. In addition, she likes to work in her association, where the members are united and hard-working people. Francisco will invest the money in the purchase of 10 cans of carrot seeds, and if there is enough money, she will buy a number of bags of natural fertilizer to nourish her plantings.

loans.use: to buy 10 cans of carrot seeds and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en una casa en anticrético ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Flora es Contadora y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a llevar  la contabilidad de varias empresas trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una fotocopiadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo por que maneja muchos documentos para sus informes.
El sueño de Flora es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Flora is divorced and has three children who are of school age. She lives in a rented house that has three rooms. The house is located in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Flora is an accountant and currently generates income by performing bookkeeping jobs for several businesses. She works for more than 10 hours a day and this is the only source of income by which she is able to pay expenses such as food, education, and basic services for her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a photocopier, which will be a great help since she must manage several documents for her reports.

Flora’s dream is to improve her earnings and her quality of life. This is the second loan she has requested from IMPRO, but her first with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier for use in her bookkeeping jobs.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en: Baraa, a 25-year-old single lady, is the youngest among six siblings. She is a fourth year university student majoring in Chemistry to become a teacher in her major. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees so she can graduate and start looking for a job.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Luis, él sigue con su actividad económica en la atención de su restaurante picantería en donde expende comida típica de la región. Luis está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  insumos como carnes, arroz, fideos, menestras y cerveza, para continuar con la producción de su comercio.
Luis está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en el mantenimiento de su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This is Sr. Luis. He continues to manage a “picantería” (a restaurant that serves spicy dishes) where he prepares traditional regional foods. Luis is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies such as meat, rice, noodles, dried vegetables, and beer so that he can continue producing in this trade.

Luis is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping him maintain his business. He is a member of the Communal Bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple), which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, noodles, dried vegetables, and beer.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 36 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde, Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Dennis has been working hard to manage his tailor shop, where he tailors garments and sells cloth. 

To help expand his business, Dennis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material for uniforms, men's trousers and umshanana (traditional Ugandan wear), and will help Dennis to generate greater profits and lead to a better standard of living for his family. Dennis hopes that in the future he will be able to have a fully stocked shop that meets the needs of customers. 

Dennis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dennis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more material for uniforms, men's trousers and umshanana (traditional Ugandan wear)

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is involved in agriculture: he keeps cows, hens and grows fruit trees. Sargis would like to increase the number of cattle, for which he needs sufficient funds. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 2 cows and 6 pigs. Sargis will also purchase forage to feed the cattle. 

Sargis lives with his wife and 2 children: an 18-year-old daughter and a 14-year-old son. Sargis is the only breadwinner in the family, and agricultural income is vital for him to cover the family's costs and ensure better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows, 6 pigs and forage to feed the cattle

loans.name: Mufeeda

texts.en: Mufeeda, a 19 years old single lady, is the oldest among five siblings. As the oldest, she wants to be a good example for them. She has enrolled herself in the university to study Managerial Information Systems. Now Mufeeda has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Ms. Sumera has a realization when her husband, who works in power loom factory, got sick. She was forced to think about the family matters as her husband and his brother were supporting the home. She decided to start supporting them in managing the family financials as they live in a combined family system. 

She is married and her two children are in school. She used her last loan from Kashf Foundation to support the General store which the run by her husband’s brother. This time she is in need of 25,000 Rs. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, buttons, etc. to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: To buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, buttons, etc

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 40 years old, and she lives with her life partner and their four children. She makes and sells raffia baskets. She works arduously every day from the very early morning to produce and to sell. She has many customers, especially because her products are of very good quality and her prices are accessible. 

Safina is gifted in her craft. It is incomparable and worthy of admiration. She is ready to see her business grow and to face any obstacles. 

She requests a loan from Yehu, and it will help her to purchase materials wholesale, including raffia, to keep making her baskets and to satisfy the needs of her clients. Safina believes that the efforts she invests in her business will help her provide her family with financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raffia for making baskets.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en:
Yazan is a 19-year-old single guy who refused to have his photo for taken cultural reasons, so he asked his father to be in the photo instead.

Yazan’s father is a butcher who owns his own shop. Yazan also is a butcher, but works in a mall to get another experience besides his father’s; after that, he will go back and work with his father. 

Now Yazan wants to support his father in the business and improve the quality of meat they sell. He has applied for this youth loan to get a better quality of meat and expand the shop.

loans.use: to get a better quality of meat and expand the shop.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: Constantina, de 39 años, es una mujer emprendedora y alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Rubén de 46 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes brinda amor y cuidado. Constantina, es una mujer hacendosa dedicada a su tienda de abarrotes (cereales, conservas, bebidas, etc.); que con tanto esfuerzo llego a obtener. Hace 12 años que empezó con estas actividades y comenta que le va muy bien con sus ventas; los clientes que acuden donde Constantina son personas que ya conocen de su labor; siempre  visitan su puesto de ventas para la compra  de consumo para sus clientes. Para Constantina, al principio fue dificultoso pero ahora, que ya logro tener lo que mas deseaba pues ahora puede ver con tranquilidad sobre los gastos que surge su hogar. Este es su crédito número 07 y agradece a los financista por el apoyo brindado para lograr sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy entusiasta y solidaria. Con los 500 nuevos soles, abastecerá su tienda con un saco de arroz y de azúcar.
texts.en:
Constantina, age 39, is an enterprising and cheerful woman. She lives in own home with her husband Rubén, age 46, and their three beloved children for whom she provides love and care. Constantina is an industrious woman who dedicates her time to her grocery store that she obtained through great effort. She sells grains, preserves, beverages, and other items. Constantina started this business 12 years ago and says that she has done very well in her sales. The customers who are served by Constantina know her because of her work. They come to her business to buy products for their own customers. Constantina found things difficult at first, but now she is able to acquire the things that she wants most. It is easier for her now to cover any household expenses that may arise.

This is her seventh loan and she is grateful to those who are supporting her so that she can accomplish the plans for her business. In her Communal bank, Constantina is an enthusiastic and supportive member. With this loan of 500 PEN, she will restock her store with a sack of rice and a sack of sugar.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 54-year-old married man and father of three children. He has 20 years of experience as a baker, but he opened the existing bakery five years ago. His work is going on just fine, but it is not enough to afford all of his family's needs; that's why he is planning to start an additional business.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to open a butcher shop, which will surely be relevant and a complement to his existing business.

His customers can be anyone in need of such products; that's why he has to keep on improving his production to attract more customers. To move the plan forward, he elects to expand his work.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop in addition to his bakery.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina, 34 years old, is a married woman. She has four children. Lina helps her husband in paying the household bills from her home business, which is selling home products and kitchenware. Now she wants to expand the business and bring in new types of home products to increase her revenue; for that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring in new types of home products to sell.

loans.name: Marío Salome

texts.es:
Don Mario tiene 49 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive con dos hijos, su nuera y un nieto. Él tiene 11 años de dedicarse a prestar sus servicios como operario de un molino de mixtamal, a demás se desempeña como agricultor con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales para la construcción de su vivienda, ya que le quiere poner piso a su casa. Con la inversión su casa será más segura, cómoda e higiénica para toda su familia. Su deseo, es poseer su propio molino y ya no ser empleado de otra persona.
texts.en:
Don Mario is 49 years old and has three children, but he lives with two of them along with a daughter-in-law and a grandson. For the past 11 years, he has been providing his service as an operator at a grain mill. Mario also works as a farmer and has the help of two of his children.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials for the construction of his home. He wants to install a floor in his home. By investing in his house, Mario will have a home that is more secure, comfortable, and cleaner for his entire family. His wish is to have his own grain mill so that he does not have to work for another person.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for installing a floor in his house.

loans.name: Adzowa

texts.fr: Adzowa a 46ans, elle est mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Adzowa exerce la profession de revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités. C'est pour développer son activité qu’elle sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES. Ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter des produits et ainsi dégager une marge plus importante pour assurer une éducation, de bonnes conditions de vie à sa famille et ouvrir par la suite une boutique.
texts.en: Adzowa is 46 and is the mother of 2 children - both of whom go to school. Adzowa sells staple items. She is asking for a loan with WAGES in order to grow her business. This loan will allow her to buy products and earn better margins. This will help her guarantee schooling and good life conditions for her family as well as open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Youssouffa

texts.fr: Monsieur Youssouffa  est un garçon marie qui habite au Sénégal.  Il capitalise une expérience de 6 ans dans le secteur du transport et conduit un taxi.  Il consacre 14 heurs de temps de la journée  à son activité.  Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour réparer son taxi qui est tombée en  panne.  Il souhaite redémarrer es activités quotidiennes  pour continuer a supporter les charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Youssouffa is a married man who lives in Senegal. He has 6 years of experience in the transportation sector and drives a taxi 14 hours a day. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 frs to repair his taxi which has broken down. He would like to start his daily work again in order to continue to help out with the family expenses.

loans.use: refurbish his taxi

loans.name: Ahonon

texts.fr: Ahanon est une jeune vendeuse sans enfants qui vit à Lomé. Ahanon a commencé son activité il y a 10 ans. Elle vend des pagnes et de la nourriture à domicile. Elle aimerait augmenter son stock afin de renforcer son activité. C'est dans ce but qu'elle sollicite un second auprès de Wages. Ahanon espère que les revenus que dégagera son activité lui permettront d’ouvrir une boutique et d’être financièrement indépendante.
texts.en: Ahanon is a young saleswoman who has no children and who lives in Lomé. Ahanon started her business 10 years ago. She sells pagnes (traditional wrap arounds) and food out of her home. She would like to increase her inventory in order to grow her business. It's with this goal in mind that she is asking for a second loan with WAGES. Ahanon hopes that the revenue from her business will allow her to open a boutique and be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional wrap arounds)

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 35 years old. She sells fabric. She has been in the business for 19 years. She wants the loan to buy more fabric to sell. The profits from the business will be used for renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to sell.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman lives in Malishka village in the Vayots Dzor region with his wife, Alisa. Arman runs a farm, where he breeds cows and grows fruit trees. Arman dreams of starting beekeeping, but does not have enough financial means to do so. He has applied for this loan to purchase eight colonies of bees. Arman also wants to increase the number of cattle by purchasing three calves. In addition, with the loan's help he will purchase grass to feed the cattle. 
Honey is very much in demand in the region as it's a must have item for each household. So, beekeeping will allow Arman to significantly increase his agricultural income and to continue expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to buy bees, calves and grass to feed the cattle

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children who go to school. She has two additional family members. She is a tailor. She operates her business in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy different types of clothing materials. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a tailoring school to serve her customers better and to get enough profits to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothing materials

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Layla, a 44-year-old hardworking woman, has seven sons and daughters. Her husband works as a truck driver. To help in supporting their family, Layla makes a special type of bread and sells it to close markets and individuals. She has applied for this loan to buy a small baker (oven) and a flour mixer to make her work easier and start making more types of bread.

loans.use: to buy a small baker and a flour mixer

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the town of Ibanda in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, John has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells posho, soda, sugar, soap and other household goods. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more general items like beans, cooking oil and soap to keep his store fully stocked. The loan will help John to generate greater profits, increase daily income and improve his livelihood. John hopes that in the future, he will be able to have a larger store. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more general items to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen's husband's income was low to support the 7 members of their family and Nasreen was worried about the health and education for her 5 children so she took the initiative and with her little savings bought a baby goat. Every year she took a loan from Kashf to increase the number of goats. Now she has a complete fleet. She sells them near Eid ul Azha (Islamic festival of sacrificing goats, bulls, camels, etc.) and earns a reasonable amount of income to contribute which substantially improves their financial condition. Currently she wants a 30,000 Rs loan to buy more goats and increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more goats and increase her business.

loans.name: Essoligmah

texts.fr: Essoligmah  est un jeune homme de 25ans. Sa femme est revendeuse et ils ont un enfant 06 mois. Il est tuilier de profession. il sollicite ce second crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’éducation et la santé de la famille.
texts.en: Essoligmah is a young man who is 25 years old. His wife works in retail and they have a 6 month old baby. He is a tiler by profession. He is asking for a second loan to stock up on goods in order to respond to his clients' needs. He would like to reinvest in his business and take care of his family's education and health.

loans.use: to buy tiles.

loans.name: Lesbia Baleska

texts.es:
La joven Lesbia tiene 30 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el vive su hija y su esposo quien le respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, su negocio es venta de abarrotería en general actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años en su comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico,  ya que esta en la calle principal de de su comunidad y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Lesbia el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, carnes, lácteos,  pollo, refrescos, azúcar, aceite, manteca, jabón, huevos, pan, etc. el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas se incrementen, ya que comprara una fuerte variedad de productos, de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de su clientes.
Lesbia los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio, de igual manera generarse buenos ingresos, y darle una buena educación a su hija y una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Lesbia is 30 years old and lives in the southern area of Honduras. Her daughter and her husband live with her, and he supports her in each of her commitments. Her business is the sale of groceries, activity she carries out since four years ago in the community where she lives. Her business is located in a strategic place, because it is in a main street of the community and this makes it very busy.

Lesbia needs the loan to buy: corn, meat, dairy, poultry, soft drinks, sugar, oil, butter, soap, eggs, bread, etc. The expected impact of the credit is an increase of sales, because she will buy a great variety of products, thus meeting the needs of each of her customers.

The future plans for Lesbia are to keep growing her business, as well as to generate good income, and to give a good education to her daughter and a better quality of life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, dairy, poultry, soft drinks, sugar, oil, butter, soap, eggs, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is a 45-year-old housewife and mother of four. Her husband has been running a barber shop for 10 years. The man shown in the photo is Zakiya’s husband. He is efficiently doing his job and earns enough to fulfill the basic necessities of life. He is very famous in his town and counts a good client list.

He wants to expand his business but minimum resources restrict him from doing so. Zakiya, on behalf of her husband, requested a loan of amount Rs 25,000 to buy more packs of hair coloring, shaving creams and cleansers. He also plans to employ one person who will assist in catering to more customers at a time. He is hopeful to get an increase in income and desires to utilize part of the income for the betterment of their children.

loans.use: To buy more packs of hair coloring, shaving creams and cleansers.

loans.name: Sidonie Anne's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe constitué de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Sidonie la responsable est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle fait de la location des chaises, des tables et des plats depuis 05 ans puis s'approvisionne auprès des grands importateurs de la place. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Sidonie se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a two-person joint liability group. Sidonie, the representative, is 38 years old, married, and has one child who goes to school. She has been renting chairs, tables, and plates for 5 years, and buys her supplies from large, local importers. With the hopes of increasing her capital and meeting customer expectations, she has asked for and obtained a microloan with Finadev in order to maximize her interest and to participate in her children's schooling. Sidonie is pictured at left.

loans.use: to buy 100 plates, 30 chairs, and 12 tables.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Doña Liliana es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos los cuales vive en su casa de habitación en el triunfo al sur de Honduras. Ella se dedica a su negocio propio que es compra y venta de ganado.
Doña Liliana el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de vacas. Ella espera que al finalizar la época de invierno pueda tener por lo menos 5 vacas,  Ya que en el invierno es una zona muy productiva de mariscos y ganadería.
Doña Liliana desea seguir trabajando duro para terminar de darle a sus hijos lo mejor que es la educación y que se conviertan en personas de bien para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Liliana is a hardworking individual. She currently lives with her husband and their six children in a house in El Triunfo, which is in southern Honduras. Liliana has her own business of buying and selling cattle.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cows. She hopes to end the winter season with five young cows in her possession. Winter in this area is a very productive time for seafood and livestock. Doña Liliana wants to continue working hard so that she can provide her children with the best education. Enabling her children to become good people will help her family move forward.

Choluteca, Honduras – August, 2012

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Haydee Teresa

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Haydee, soltera con 53 años de edad, ella se dedica  al comercio de artesanías, principalmente con productos de plata como joyería y adornos.
Haydee está solicitando el préstamo para comprar vitrinas para que pueda exhibir de mejor manera sus productos. Haydee está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite crecer en su actividad. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Sra. Haydee. She is 53 years old and single. Haydee sells handicrafts, primarily silver products such as jewelry and ornaments.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy display cases so that she will have a better way of exhibiting her products. Haydee is extremely grateful to Kiva for the assistance that has been provided so that she can strengthen and grow her business. She is a member of the Communal Bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple), which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy display cases for exhibiting her merchandise.

loans.name: Jeanine Monique

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Jeanine est mariée et mère de 04 enfants scolarisés dans une école de la place. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement de 17 ans et 03 ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des divers et des produits congelés depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et a un grand nombre de clients compte tenu du bon emplacement de sa boutique. Dans le souci de renforcer son activité et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à FINADEV-SA. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
44 years old, Jeanine is married and the mother of four children who all attend a local school. The eldest is 17 and the youngest 3 years old. She has a store where she has sold general groceries and frozen goods for several years. She buys her stock at one of Benin's markets, and has a considerable customer base as her store is in a good location.
With the objective of growing her business and responding positively to customer demand, she has sought and obtained financial assistance from FINADEV-SA in order to buy two crates of fish, two crates of meat and two sacks of rice. This financing will allow her to maximise her additional revenue and to help cover the costs of her childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy two crates of fish, two crates of meat and two sacks of rice.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy, es una mujer activa tiene 29 años; vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Omar y su único hijo, Javier de 06 años, a quien le da lo mejor para tener un buen futuro. Lucy, es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su puesto de ventas trata de sobresalir adelante. Ella es comerciante y tiene un tienda de abarrotes situado en su comunidad. La bodega de Lucy, es muy frecuentado por sus  vecinos ya que ella les brinda buen trato; apertura las puertas de su negocio desde tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de encontrar los productos indicados para sus necesidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para incrementar en su tienda. Este es su crédito número 05, se siente orgullosa de saber que contara con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir trabajando. Agradece a su banco comunal por permitirles trabajar y se compromete a ser responsable con los pagos de su cuota.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; comprará más víveres para incrementar en su tienda.
texts.en:
Lucy is an active woman who is 29 years of age. She lives in her own home with her partner Omar and their only son, six-year-old Javier, for whom she provides the best so that he will have a good future.

Lucy is an industrious woman who has a shop where she conducts sales in order to get ahead. She is a merchant and her grocery store is located in her community. Her shop is frequented by her neighbors since she provides good service. The doors of her business are opened in the early morning hours when she is ready to welcome her first customers. Lucy knows that having a variety of merchandise in her store will encourage people to buy. She is certain that the products she has in stock will meet her customers’ needs. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to talk with her customers, since conversation is a skill that she employs to gain more business. Lucy has been in this line of work for four years and says that the most difficult part is being on her feet for almost the entire day.

With the loan she requested, she will buy more food products for her store. This will be her fifth loan and she is proud to know that she has the support of lenders who will help her continue working. Lucy is grateful to her Communal Bank for allowing her to work with the group and she promises to be responsible with her loan payments. This loan of 1,000 PEN will be used to buy merchandise to increase the inventory in her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Numonjon

texts.ru: Нумонджону 20 лет. Он холост и живет с родителями. Она является студентом 2 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета по специальности преподавателя физической культуры. Он очень способный студент и учится на хорошие оценки. Его родители занимаются земледелием и скотоводством, но их доход не позволяет оплатить за учебу сына. Нумонджон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Numonjon is a 20-year-old sophomore at Khujand State University, where he studies physical education. He is a very talented student with good grades. He is single and lives with his parents. 

Numonjon's parents work in crop farming and cattle breeding, but their income is not enough to cover their son's education expenses. So, Numonjon is requesting this loan to pay for his university fees. He is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To pay for his education at the university

loans.name: Mbathie's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de deux femme se sont réunies par affinité et voisinage. Leur principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Mbathie âgée de 59 ans est mariée et mère de 05 filles et de 02 garçons.
Assise sur la chaise à gauche de la photo ; elle fait du commerce;en achetant des moutons et des brebis qu'elle élève. Quand la brebis met bas; elle vend les agneaux; Au cas ou se sont des mâles et des femelles; elle vend la brebis et élève l'agnelle jusqu'à maturité et refait le même processus.
Ce crédit lui permettras d'acheter 05 moutons et 03 brebis qu'elle va élever; mais aussi des aliments pour bétail et des vaccins pour les animaux.
Avec les bénéfices générées;elle s'occupe de sa famille; en leur payant leur scolarité,en participant dans la dépense quotidienne et la santé des enfants.
Mais aussi c'est avec le bénéfice qu'elle paye ses intérêts du prêt et aussi qu'elle dépose ses épargnes.
texts.en:
These two women are both friends and neighbours, and have formed a group. Their main activities are business and animal fattening. Mbathie is 59 years old, a married mother of five girls and three boys. She is seated on the left hand chair in the photo. She is a trader; she buys sheep and ewes which she rears. When the ewe has her lambs, she sells the males. Where there are both males and females, she sells the ewe and rears the young females until maturity, when she repeats the process.
This loan will allow her to buy five sheep and three ewes, which she will rear; it will also allow her to buy feed and medication for the animals. With the profits, she will help her family - paying for schooling, contributing to the daily expenses and the health of the children. In addition, she will use the profits to pay the interest on the loan, and to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes for rearing.

loans.name: Enakhon

texts.ru: Энахон родилась 1994 году. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. В этом году она окончила среднюю школу и успешно поступила в филиал Таджикский Технологический Государственного Университета в городе Исфаре. Она очень способная девушка и хочет стать успешным специалистом. Доход ее родителей от скотоводства не хватает оплатить за учебу в университете. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты годового учебного договора. Энахон ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Enakhon was born in 1994. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. This year she finished high school and was accepted to the Isfare branch of Tajik State University of Technology. She is a very talented girl and would like to have a successful career. Her parents breed cattle, but their income is not enough to cover her university fees. She is requesting this loan to pay for a year's tuition. She is waiting for your kindness!

loans.use: To pay for university study.

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr: Jeune revendeur de pneus et jantes aluminium sur étalage, mr Koami est âgé de 26ans.  Il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. a l’avenir, il veut acheter une moto pour faciliter son déplacement, louer un magasin dans lequel il va exposer ses marchandises et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Koami is 26 years old, he is a young seller of tyres and aluminium wheel rims which he has on display. He is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to buy merchandise that will meet his customers' needs. In the future, he wants to buy a motorbike to make it easier to get around, and to rent a shop where he can offer his products. He also wants to get married in due course.

loans.use: to buy tyres and aluminium wheel rims.

loans.name: Firuzakhon

texts.ru: Прекрасная женщина из Таджикистана нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Фирузахон и ей 24 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Доход ее мужа Хусрава не достаточно для оплаты обучения Фирузахон в колледже, так как она является студенткой 3 курса Медицинского колледжа. Она должна оплатить годовой договор и поэтому она запрашивает займ для оплаты обучения в колледже. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A wonderful young woman from Tajikistan needs your help. Her name is Firuzakhon. She is a 24-year-old wife and mother of two young children. 

Firuzakhon's husband does not make enough money to pay for her fees as a third year student at the local medical college. So, she is requesting this loan to pay for a year's tuition at college. She is hoping for your kindness!

loans.use: To pay for her study at college

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
DÚO ESTRELLAS DE SAN MATEO
Este dúo está conformado por doña María Candelaria, ella tiene 52 años de edad y 4 hijos a su cargo aun ya que nos comenta que tuvo la oportunidad de procrear a 13 hijos la mayoría de ellos casados ya con familia, ella está solicitando el crédito para invertir en su venta de consumo diario(productos comestibles)como arroz, frijol, maíz, azúcar, sal, fideos, sopas instantáneas, aceite, aguas gaseosas, etc.,  negocio que lo tiene en su domicilio su propósito es lograr comprar su vitrina con las ganancias que obtenga y la otra parte para invertir en siembra de suchini, y ejote que normalmente este ha sido su trabajo desde que han convivido con su esposo, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado y desde ya les envia Bendiciones en donde se encuentran.
texts.en:
Estrellas de San Mateo (Stars of St. Matthew) Group

This group includes Doña María Candelaria, who is 52 years old and currently has four children under her care. She says that she gave birth to 13 children and most of them are grown, married, and have their own families.

María Candelaria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of everyday consumer products (food) such as rice, beans, corn, sugar, salt, noodles, instant soups, oil, carbonated water, and other items. Her business is located in her home. María Candelaria’s goal is to buy a display cabinet with the profit she earns. Part of her gains will be invested in planting zucchini and green beans, a task that she normally performed when she lived with her husband. She hopes to receive the loan she requested since it will be blessing for her.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, salt, noodles, instant soups, oil, carbonated water, and other items.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Madame Adjovi vit avec son conjoint et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé.  Tous sont sur les bancs d’école. Ils sont âgés de 15, 10 et 07ans. Après la fin de son apprentissage, elle a ouvert son atelier dans lequel elle coud des habits à ses clients qui viennent de parts et  d’autres de la ville de Lomé. Elle à 03 apprentis qui lui prêtent main forte dans l’exécution de son activité. Pour permettre à ses derniers d’avoir de matériels suffisant pour pouvoir apprendre le métier, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des machines et aménager son atelier. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle voudrait avoir un grand atelier, être une couturière de renom et avoir une famille bien éduquée.
texts.en:
Adjovi lives with her partner and their three children in Lomé. All three attend school - they are 15, 10 and 7 years old.
Having completed her apprenticeship, she opened her workshop where she sews outfits for her customers who come from various areas in the city of Lomé. She has three apprentices who assist her with the work required. In order for these apprentices to have the necessary equipment to learn the trade, she is seeking a second loan with WAGES in order to buy sewing machines and to renovate the workshop. As to the future, she would like to have a large workshop, to be a well known seamstress and to have a well educated family.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and renovate the workshop.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits génériques et d’alimentation générale à domicile, Mawussi âgée de 29ans est mariée à un conducteur de taxi et ils ont ensemble 03 enfants. Les deux premiers âgés de 08 et 05ans sont sur les bancs d’école. Quant au dernier âgé de 07 mois, il ne va pas encore à  l’école. Afin d’avoir un stock de quantité considérable de produits d’alimentation générale et des produits génériques, elle sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES pour s’en approvisionner. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut louer une boutique et assurer les besoins de la famille. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 06ans.
texts.en:
Mawussi is a retailer of generic products and general groceries from her home. She is 29 years old and married to a taxi driver; they have three children together. The two eldest - aged eight and five - attend school. The youngest is seven months old and does not yet go to school. In order to have a good quantity of merchandise in stock, she is seeking a third loan with WAGES in order to buy the necessary items.
For the future, she wants to rent a shop and to take care of her family's needs. She has been in this business for six years.

loans.use: to buy food products and general grocery goods.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba works for SOSAI Renewable Energies, a Barefoot Power distributor in Nigeria. 

This is her story: 

SOSAI Renewable Energies Company is a registered company in Nigeria working as a social enterprise targeting the people at the bottom of the pyramid. The organization works to offer reliable, efficient, and affordable technologies to households to improve their livelihoods. 

Work in this sector began at SOSAI in 2010. The organisation had existed as a fully commercial company before this, but now we operate as a social enterprise. 

SOSAI was set up by Habiba, who is a founder, and who had worked for Developmental Association for Renewable Energies (DARE), where she had got the opportunity to carry out exhibitions and workshops for people in rural areas and urban slums highlighting the benefits of renewable energies. Because DARE is an NGO sales were limited by DARE, so Habiba decided to branch out to revive SOSAI. With benefitting people at the forefront, running this organisation as a social enterprise was paramount. 

The idea behind the project of creating micro-enterprise by providing solar lighting is to empower small entrepreneurs who can penetrate more communities by giving them the opportunity to buy products and pay for them in installments, with an agreed upon plan and model. This will develop micro-enterprise, especially for women, while ensuring that a large number of people get all-important lighting into their homes, at the same time empowering more by giving them a means of livelihood. With the high number of households not connected to the grid--despite its rich energy resources--Nigeria is a fertile ground to grow this business as in the past 10 years (in spite of the government's promises) the power sector has only worsened with more power cuts and fewer people being connected to the grid. 

According to the WHO 1.6 million deaths occur yearly from indoor air pollution; this project will in the long run reduce green-house gas emissions while improving maternal health and ensuring basic education as longer study hours will be ensured. 

Benefits accruable to using Solar Home Systems as provided by Barefoot Power are immense, but the most important reason for SOSAI undertaking this comes from a personal experience Habiba has had with kerosene lamps while assisting her mother who owned a "Bukka," a term used to describe a small eatery, where they worked till late at night using kerosene lamps. Her mother currently has an eye problem because of the exposure to indoor air pollution and Habiba herself wears glasses. What better drive to promote a cleaner source of lighting than personal experience? 

The business model will be fully developed to include training for the business owners and training of technical staff that will ensure the warranty Barefoot Power prides itself in. 

This loan will enable SOSAI to better promote this sales model and move deeper into the rural areas especially to give the organization the strength to be able to fall back and take on the steam at any time.

loans.use: To sell solar lighting to people who don't have electricity

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel works for NRG Solution, a Barefoot Power distributor in Cambodia. 

This is his story: 

I came to Cambodia three years ago and saw the desperate need for basic access to electricity. With 80% of the population not having access to any kind of distributed electricity there was a lot of potential to improve people's lives by giving them access to basic electricity. Most people depend on car batteries and kerosene lights, which is inadequate, inefficient, labor intensive, and unsafe. 

NRG Solutions was established with the goal of providing sustainable, appropriate, and affordable solar energy solutions to Cambodia and S.E. Asia. Our team began working under the name Yejj Solar, as part of a larger NGO. This experience helped us learn about the local and regional market. We tested different models and approaches to the distribution of solar energy into remote areas. Earlier this year we decided to transition out of the NGO model into a social enterprise model, in order to improve sustainability as we saw the need to scale up. Our approach has two fundamental pillars: quality and service. We have slowly introduced Barefoot Power products in order to build the brand and trust in the products. By building a network of entrepreneurs to which we offer constant training and support we are pushing this emphasis of quality and service down to the end customer. This has quickly allowed us to differentiate ourselves from distributors of cheaper products with no after-sales service. 

Your contributions will help us bring much needed stock in order to meet the large demand and grow the business. This stock will then be given to local entrepreneurs we have trained to sell these products in very remote areas of the country, where they are most needed. This loan will help us in that final push to establish our business and the Barefoot Power products into a known and trusted brand. The largest challenge with solar energy in Cambodia is the lack of trust due to the availability of very cheap, low quality products, and no after-sales service support. Barefoot Power provides the best quality and easiest-to-service products in the market. 

Our efforts and patience in building trust in our brand have recently and quickly translated into larger and larger demand. We are currently not able to meet demand due to lack of funds to place larger orders, which can be solved with initial financing. We envision a network of entrepreneurs all over the country reaching the most remote and needed families, in order to make a significant difference in their lives with reliable, adequate, modern, and green energy.

loans.use: To sell renewable solar lighting

loans.name: Dossou

texts.fr: Mr Dossou est un jeune commerçant âgé de 29ans. Il n’a pas de personnes en charge. Il vend des boissons canettes nommées Ghana castlle de façon ambulante aux détenteurs de bars de cafétariat et aux particuliers. Il manque de fonds pour s’approvisionner en marchandises car les demandes deviennent de plus en plus croissantes c’est pour cela, il fait appel à WAGES par ce premier prêt. Avec les profits qu’il réalisera, il va avoir une boutique dans laquelle il va exposer ses marchandises, acheter un terrain pour construire et avoir une famille. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2011.
texts.en: Dossou is a young trader who is 29 years old. He does not have any dependents. He sells canned drinks called Ghana Castle on a door-to-door basis to bar and cafe owners as well as private individuals. Demand is becoming increasingly strong and he does not have sufficient funds to get fresh supplies; he is thus requesting this first loan from WAGES. With the profits he makes he is going to have a shop where he will display his goods, buy a piece of land to build on and have a family. He has been carrying out this business since 2011.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Coiffeuse et en même revendeuse de produits de beauté et des mèches dans une boutique, madame Alimatou a 03 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs d’école. L’ainé est âgé de 05ans et le dernier 03 mois.  Elle est à son premier à WAGES et cet argent lui servira à s’approvisionner en mèches, tissages et des produits de beauté. Avec les profits qu’elle réalisera, elle veut rouvrir d’autres salons de coiffure. Comme perspectives d’avenir pour la famille, elle voudrait avoir une boutique de vente de pagnes et prendre ce bénéfice pour assurer les besoins de ses enfants. Notons qu’il est dans ce domaine il y a 06ans et que son conjoint est revendeur.
texts.en: Alimatou is a hairdresser and at the same time a retailer of beauty products and hair extensions in a shop. She has three children, two of whom attend school. The eldest is five years old and the youngest three months. She is on her first loan from WAGES and this money will be used to get fresh supplies of hair extensions and beauty products. With the profits she makes she wants to open other hairdressing salons. Looking ahead to her family's future, she would like to open a shop selling "pagnes" (colourful pieces of fabric) and she is going to use her profits to provide for her children's needs. It should be noted that she has been active in this field for six years and that her husband is a retailer.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar vive la señorita María Monserrate, tiene 20 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Estudia cosmetología en una Universidad de Portoviejo.
 
Ella además de ser una muy buena estudiante para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarse con los gastos de sus estudios, realiza trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal y así saca provecho de lo que está estudiando, realiza diversidad de trabajos, como tinturados, maquillajes, pintado de uñas,  entre otros trabajos. Trabaja todos los días y  cuando sus clientes requieren de sus servicios la llaman por teléfono o llegan hasta su casa ya que  ella también realiza trabajos en su casa y a domicilio. Lleva 5 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ciertas herramientas de belleza que necesita, tintes y cosméticos para su trabajo. Este es su sexto ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son algún dia tener un SPA y  terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
In the citadel of El Florón, the city of Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí which has been known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, every two weeks the members of the ‘Rebirth’ Communal Bank get together.

Miss María Monserrate lives in this place, she is 20 years old, single and lives in her parents’ home. She is studying to be a cosmetologist in the University of Portoviejo.

Besides being a good student she has her own income that she uses to help pay for her education and also does beauty consultations and individual makeovers which she uses to practice of what she is studying. María does different types of work like hair dying, makeup, nails, and other jobs. She works everyday and when her customers require her services they call or go to her residence since she works from her home and does house calls as well. María has worked in this field for 5 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy certain beauty tools that she needs for her work like, dyes and makeup. This is her sixth loan cycle with the communal bank and says that she likes it for the ease of getting loans.

Her dreams are to one day have a SPA and to finish her education.

loans.use: buy certain beauty tools that she needs for her work like, dyes and makeup.

loans.name: Luisa Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 8 años de edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es maestro.

Ella para salir adelante y ganar algo por su cuenta sin depender de su esposo se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres y dulces de muchas formas y sabores los cuales son muy apetecidos por los turistas que pasan por el sector, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayuda en su negocio cuando pueden, lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien ya que gracias a los créditos cada vez lo surte mas.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para surtir más su tienda, va a comprar dulces, arroz, azúcar, embutidos, detergentes y toda clase de víveres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 15 años y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. 

Sus metas son seguir aumentado su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos
texts.en:
The Para el Futuro De la Mujer communal bank gets together every two weeks in La Pila, Montecristi. This place is well-known both in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture; one can find a great variety of handicrafts that are made by the locals using the traditional customs. 

This is where Luisa lives. She is a 39-year-old married mother of three, ages 16, 14, and 8. The two eldest are in secondary school while the youngest is in elementary school. Luisa's husband is a teacher. 

In order to get ahead and make her own money without having to depend on her husband, she is a small business owner. She runs a small general store from home, where she sells all types of provisions and candies that the local tourists crave. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes even later. Her children her with the business whenever they can, and she has been quite prosperous because thanks to these loans, she is able to stock up her business more and more. 

She will use this loan to stock up on all types of provisions. She has been with the bank for 15 years, and she likes it because she started her business with a loan. 

Her goals are to expand her business and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, rice, sugar, canned items, detergents and other goods

loans.name: Idalia Margarita

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

La señora Idalia, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  mayores de edad, su hija aun vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Idalia tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a sabados desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde ya que solo prepara desayunos y almuerzos. Trabaja sola y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que por su casa pasan todos los días cientos de personas que se desplazan a otras ciudades y porque ella prepara diferentes platos para todos los gustos, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para poder seguir adelante con su negocio.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que sui negocio mejore aun más.
texts.en:
