In the future, she would like to open a palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil.

loans.name: Favour

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Favour from Moriba Town Branch, Southern Area, Bo District. She is married with two children, ages 6 and 15 years old. Both of her children attend school. Favour runs a clothing and textiles store. She sells blouses, jeans, skirts and African dress. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., 7 days per week. The business is the only source of income she has. At present, she is challenged with transportation costs. 

Favour requested a loan in order to buy more clothes such as blouses, jeans, skirts and African dress. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her status. In the future, she wants to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as blouses, jeans, skirts and African dress.

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rey de Reyes lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María del Carmen quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 18 años y tiene un molino. Su meta es llegar a tener un minisúper y el crédito lo invertirá para surtir el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son María quien tiene una tortillería con su suegra y Luz quien vende hielo, helados y sopa los domingos.
texts.en:
The “Rey the Reyes” group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  Maria del Carmen is one of the members and she has had a general store for 18 years.  She also has a mill.  Her goal is to have a small supermarket and this loan will help her to stock her business.

The other members include Maria, who has a tortilla factory with her mother in law, and Luz who sells ice, frozen treats, and soup on Sundays.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fatu is 38 years old and married with four children, ages 11 years to 18 years old. She runs a food stand business in Torkpoi town, Southern area, Bo District in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for seven years and sells rice, onions, Maggi, peppers, and groundnuts at the market area. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase rice, oil, palm oil, peppers, and groundnuts. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, palm oil, peppers, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Gs El Mercado 2 Group

texts.es:
El joven Denis es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicado a su negocio que es la venta de mercadería nueva, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez es en grandes cantidades ya que esta en el centro de la ciudad y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Denis el crédito que se le otorgo fue para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas, ropa de niño para surtir más su negocio. El impacto obtenido  con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incrementaron en gran manera, ya que pudo comprar variedad de producto y así de esta manera pudo satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes, de igual manera generarse mejores ingresos.
A Denis le gustaría seguir trabajando, con este tipo de crédito, ya que han servido de mucho apoya para el crecimiento de su actividad comercial. Los planes a futuro de Denis es seguir creciendo en su negocio propio, y tener mejores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Doris Gonsalina se dedica a la venta de mercadería y sandalias.
Fernando se dedica a la venta de mercadería y accesorio de vestir.

Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Denis is a very hard-working young man, who is dedicated to his business selling new merchandise, an activity which he has been involved in for 6 years. His business is located in a strategic position, where there is a large flow of people as it is in the city centre, and this means that many people visit it. 
Denis was granted the loan to buy merchandise such as trousers, skirts, shirts, blouses and children's clothes to stock his business better. The impact of the loan has been to considerably increase his sales, as he was able to buy a variety of products with which he could satisfy the needs of each of his customers, and at the same time, generate higher earnings. 
Denis would like to continue working with this kind of loan, as they have been of great help to him in expanding his commercial activity. Denis' future plans are to continue growing in his own business and to increase his profits to give his family a better quality of life. 
Doris Gonsalina works selling merchandise and sandals. 
Fernando works selling merchandise and accessories. 

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2012.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, shirts, blouses and children's clothes for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish the exterior and plaster the top floor of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals and corn to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Chan Thea

texts.en:
Chan Thea is 42 years old. She is married and resides with her parents and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a stove and ladder producer who earns about $7 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 each day. 

Chan Thea is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay her child’s school fees. In addition, a part of this money will be used to buy a computer for her child. This money will help her child earn higher education. In the future, she would like to purchase a truck for transporting stoves to sell and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay her child's school fees

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en: Zacarias is 53 years old and comes from the community of San Miguel, Bohol.  He is married with one adult son. For many years now, Zacarias has been growing rice  to earn a living. He would like to expand his business and improve his yield. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay rental fees for a tractor and quality seedlings.  These will be vital for his farming success. In the future, he would like to have a bigger farm for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and pay for tractor rental

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima hails from Trinidad, Bohol.  She is 42 years old and married with four children aged 12, 17, 20 and 24. With her spouse, she works hard in the farm growing rice for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and pay school fees.  She wants to increase her income for her family’s benefit.  Any additional profit will go towards expansion of her farming business. In the future, she hopes to see her children having a better chance in life through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married, with five children, ages 5 to 27 years. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol. 

She has depended on her income from rice farming for more than two decades now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay  labor costs. These will help her to get a better return on her investment. 

She hopes that through this loan, she can further expand her business, making the most profit and providing her family daily consumption and income out of her harvest. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm to cultivate, so she and her family can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Justa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Justa del Carmen es una microempresaria exitosa que se dedica a la compra de cosechas de tamarindo  y las comercializa en el país de Honduras desde hace varios años.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tres palos de tamarindo para luego después comercializarlos y de esa manera aumentara su negocio.
texts.en: Justa del Carmen is a successful small businesswoman who has been working buying tamarind crops and selling them in Honduras for several years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of three sticks of tamarind so that she can later sell them and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tamarind crops.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
This is Ma. Fe, 35, resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Cresencio and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Fe operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Fe hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like fabric, thread, etc. needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 31, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Levfelic, a driver, and has one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a variety store business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennifer's business is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She gets supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece for a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Jennifer is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jennifer hopes to give her child a quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbeque.

loans.name: Sothan

texts.en:
Sothan is 26 years old. She is married and resides with two children and her grandfather in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in garment factory for a year, earning about $3 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $16 each day. 

To improve her husband’s business, Sothan is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a mortar for her husband to use in his construction work. This purchase will help him work faster. 

In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a mortar for her husband to use in his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mirian Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora. Mirian es una socia activa del banco comunal La Paz hace 11 años, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que esta bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su Centro Histórico es una mezcla de la arquitectura colonial y la arquitectura moderna, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su vestimenta es muy colorida la cual le regala color y alegría a la ciudad.

La Señora. Mirian es casada, tiene 38 años de edad y 2 hijos de 15 y 9 años, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios en una compañía privada, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad construida en unión conyugal.

Ella trabaja como consultora en la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas y también vende ropa por catalogo, esta actividad la desempeña hace 8 años, no tiene día fijo para realizar sus ventas ya que ofrece sus productos cuando se le presenta la ocasión. Los fines de semana se dedica al arreglo de varias casas.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos para ampliar sus productos y así ofrecer a su selecta clientela. 

Su sueño es darles a sus hijos los estudios universitarios para que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
For the past 11 years, Mirian has been an active member of the "La Paz" (The Peace) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca that is bathed by four rivers, which have given the city the name "Santa Ana of the 4 Rivers."  Since December of 1999, it has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity site.  Its historic center is a mix of colonial and modern architecture and its people maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.  Their clothes are very brightly colored, which gives color and joy to the city.

Mirian is married and 38 years old.  She has two sons, ages 15 and 9.  Her eldest son is in secondary school and her second son attends a small local school.  Her husband is a professional chauffeur and lends his services to a private company.  The house where they live is their own, built together as a result of their relationship.

She works as a consultant, selling a variety of brands of cosmetics and she also sells clothes by catalog.  She has been working at this for 8 years.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule for her sales, since she offers her products when the opportunity presents itself.  She spends the weekends fixing up various houses.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of clothes and cosmetics to expand her products and thus offer a better selection to her customers.

Her dream is to provide her sons with a university education so that they can become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie of San Miguel, Bohol, has had a rice farming business for two years now. She is 27 years old and married, with a two-year-old son. Marjorie is inspired to work hard so she can help her husband, who works as a security guard. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings and pay for labor costs during land preparation. Her income from the harvest will provide for her child's needs, like milk and diapers, and for her family's daily consumption. In the future, she hopes to have other business options, so she can better provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Odile est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont deux sont scolarisés dans une école de la place. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 25ans et 16ans. Elle vend de divers et des boissons dans une boutique sise à son domicile depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Sa clientèle large et diversifiée est essentiellement composée des habitants du quartier et de ses environs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Odile is 48 years of age, married, and a mother to three children. Two of her children are at school in the town where they live. Her oldest child is 25 years of age, while the youngest is 16. 

Odile works selling various items and drinks in a store in her home, and has done so for several years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin, as well as abroad. She has a large, diverse customer base, which comprises both local residents and people from the surrounding area. In order to strengthen her business, as well as to meet her customers’ needs, Odile has sought financing from Finadev. She plans to use this loan to make the most of her business, as well as to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy one box of milk, one box of sardines, one box of spaghetti, five crates of beer and four crates of candies.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita María, soltera con 26 años de edad y 2 hijos en edad escolar, ella se dedica  al  comercio de elementos de artesanías en general como ropa, joyería y adornos.
María está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como pulseras, anillos, aretes, adornos y ropa como chompas, bufandas y gorros, para capitalizar su actividad. María está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor educación a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old and she has 2 children who go to school. She engages in selling crafts in general such as clothes, jewels and ornaments.
María is requesting a loan to buy products such as bracelets, rings, earrings, ornaments as well as items of clothing such as sweaters, scarfs and hats in order to capitalize her activity. María is deeply grateful to KIVA’s help, as this helps her strengthening her economic activity, thus allowing her to provide a better education to her children. She is a member of “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca Temple), a Communal Bank of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy jewels, items of clothing and ornaments.

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Senderos está formado por 8 mujeres quienes se dedican a realizar varias actividades económicas las mismas que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son mujeres luchadoras  que trabajan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es conocida desde Diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos, cuenta con varios lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y cordial, su mayor orgullo es mantener su cultura y tradiciones. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Gladys, está realizando su cuarto crédito en el banco comunal Nuevos Senderos, vive por el sector del Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo una unidad de taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Ella es oriunda de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tachilas y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca desde hace 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un año, vende recorriendo la ciudad 3 días a la semana y sin un horario fijo, su mercadería es muy variada ya que tiene todo tipo de ropa para su exigente clientela. También trabaja medio tiempo como empleada domestica hace un año.
 
Como es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una carreta para dedicarse a la venta de pinchos (carne en palito).

Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The ‘Nuevos Senderos’ [New Paths] communal bank is comprised of eight women who devote themselves to various business activities.  These business activities allow them to improve their household finances.  They are tenacious women who work day to day in order to get their families ahead.

They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, which has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since 1999. It is bathed by four rivers, and it has various places to visit and to enjoy nature.  Its people are kind, charming, and cordial.  Its greatest pride is maintaining its culture and traditions.

Gladys is one of the members of the group.  This is her fourth loan with the Nuevos Senderos communal bank.  She lives in the Vergel sector of the city of Cuenca.  She is 25 years old and married.  They have two children, ages six and four.  Her first daughter goes to a school in the area.  Her husband is a driver, and he works driving a taxi.  They do not have their own house; so they rent where they live.

She is from the Santo Domingo de los Tachilas province, and she has lived in the city of Cuenca for eight years.  She has been selling clothes for one year.  She sells by traveling throughout the city, without a fixed schedule, three days a week.  She has a great variety of merchandise.  She has all types of clothes for her discerning clientele.  She has also been working for one year as a domestic employee, which she does part-time.

As a tenacious and hard-working woman, she will use her new loan to buy a cart in order to sell ‘pinchos’ (meat on a stick).  

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snacks and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Dúo Lleno De Gracia 3 Group

texts.es:
Lleno de Gracia 3.
Este Dúo está Conformado por angélica originaria de Sumpango y muy trabajadora, ella es dueña de locales que están ubicados en la entrada al municipio, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles como, arroz, frijol, fideos, aceite, etc. y también desea hacer arreglos en su local para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Angélica is a member of the communal bank Lleno de Gracia 3. She is from Sumpango and is very hardworking. She owns stalls, located at the town´s entrance, where she sells basic food products. She is requesting a loan to buy food products like rice, beans, noodles, oil, and so forth. She also wants to repair her stall so that she can provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, beans, noodles, oil, and so forth.

loans.name: Naylea Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita Naylea, soltera con 20 años de edad, ella se dedica  al  comercio de elementos de artesanía en general como ropa, joyería, instrumentos musicales y adornos en cerámica, Naylea desea hacer crecer su actividad comercial y trabaja mucho para diferenciarse de los demás comerciantes del rubro, ya que existe una fuerte competencia.
Naylea está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como tejidos, adornos e instrumentos musicales. La Socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer  y hacer crecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor vida a los suyos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Naylea is 20 years old and she is single. She engages in selling general crafts such as clothes, jewels, musical instruments and ceramic ornaments. Naylea wants to make her activity grow and she works very hard to stand out from the other retailers in her line of business, as she has many competitors.
Naylea is requesting a loan to buy products such as fabrics, ornaments and musical instruments. She is deeply grateful to KIVA’s help, as this helps her strengthening her economic activity and making it grow, thus allowing her to provide a standard of living to her family. She is a member of “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca Temple), a Communal Bank of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, ornaments and musical instruments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products from Avon to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials in making wedding gowns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La socia es la señora Bertha, ella continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de ropa en un centro comercial de la ciudad. Bertha trabaja duro para mantener su establecimiento comercial y estar implementando siempre con mejores productos, por ello la socia está solicitando el préstamo, para comprar mercadería como pantalones, casacas, polos y chompas y estar lista para la próxima campaña navideña,  y por ello está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer y hacer crecer su actividad económica. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC SONCCO”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Bertha continues to sell clothing at a mall in the city. She works hard to maintain her business and is always adding better items. So, she is applying for a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, coats, polos, and sweaters to be ready for the coming Christmas season. She thanks Kiva for its support, which helps her strenghten and grow her business. She belongs to the communal bank “SUMAC SONCCO” in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, coats, polos, and sweaters.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 43 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Isabel y sus hijos en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Encontramos a Alejandro trabajando en el relleno de la tapa de agua de su pueblo, desde muy temprano se dirige a los trabajos de asfaltado de la carretera hacia su pueblo, se siente muy contento; pues los pobladores tendrán una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo mayor acceso para llevar las cosechas de alimentos a la ciudad para ser vendidos. Desde  hace algunos años se dedica al trabajo de albañil y en la actualidad  se encuentra trabajando en esta obra civil, en compañía con algunos de sus colegas, espera poder obtener una buena ganancia por ello, “tengo que aprovechar esta oportunidad, es dinero seguro y pagan bien”, afirma. Como hijo del campo también se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, sembrando productos agrícolas y criando ovejas y ganado vacuno. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, en todo este tiempo agradece el apoyo obtenido, pues le ayudó a salir adelante y mejorar el capital para sus actividades económicas. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores oportunidades. Alejandro, invertirá el dinero en la compra de maderas para y herramientas para  sus trabajos en construcción.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 43 years old, is a responsible man. He lives with his wife, Isabel, and children in the house that he bought several years ago. We find him  doing fill work over the village's water system.  From very early he works asphalting the highway to his village and is very happy doing so because then the inhabitants will have a better quality of life and greater access so they can take their food crops to the city to sell them.

For several years Alejandro has been working as a mason and currently is doing this kind of construction, along with some of his colleagues, and he expects to be able to make a good income from it. “I have to take advantage of this opportunity. it is a steady income and they pay well,” he states. As a son of the countryside, he also farms and raises livestock; he cultivates agricultural crops and raises sheep and cattle.

This is his eighth loan with MFP and in all this time he has been grateful for the help he has received because it has helped him get ahead and increase his capital for his economic activities. Consequently he promises to be punctual with his payments as he has been with previous loans. Alejandro will use the money to purchase wood and tools for his construction work.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools.

loans.name: Dolores Esmeralda

texts.es:
La Señora. Dolores es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive por la parroquia Ricuarte que se encuentra ubicada al noroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, Ricaurte está constituida por treinta y tres barrios, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y sus principales cultivos son el maíz y la papa, cría de animales como ganado y cuyes, sus mujeres visten sus trajes típicos como son las polleras que es una falda con pliegues ancha y vistosamente adornada, blusa blanca, paño, alpargatas y sombrero blanco, son personas amables y gentiles.

La Señora. Dolores es madre soltera de 5 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, dos de sus hijos trabajan solo para sus gastos personales y su último hijo de 12 años está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Dolores tiene un restaurante desde hace un año y medio, trabaja en el de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que está realizando en la banca comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ollas, vajillas y víveres para la elaboración de sus productos. 

Su meta es agrandar más su negocio y  tener sucursales.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the “La Paz” communal bank and lives in the Ricuarte parish, located in the northeast of the city of Cuenca, and is made up of 36 neighborhoods.  Its residents are farmers and their main crops are corn and potatoes.  They also raise animals, such as livestock and Guinea pigs.  The women wear typical clothing, such as “polleras,” which is a wide and very pretty skirt.  They also wear white blouses, cloth and canvas shoes and white hats.  They are kind and gentle people.

Dolores is the single mother of five children, two of whom are married and on their own.  Two of her other children work only to earn money for their personal expenses.  The youngest one, age 12, attends a local school.  She lives in a rented home.

Dolores has had a restaurant for a year and a half and works seven days a week from 7:00am to 7:00pm.

This will be her fourth loan in the communal bank and she will invest the money in pots, flatware, and ingredients to make her products.

Her goal is to grow her business and set up other branches.

loans.use: to buy pots, flatware, and ingredients.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working on a rubber plantation for more than a year, earning about $20 daily.

To improve her family’s finances, Lun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating cassava. This money will help her generate additional income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her farming and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new and bigger house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating cassava

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La socia es la señora Rosa, casada y con 3 hijos, ella continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de mochilas e implementos deportivos en una de las ferias más importantes de la ciudad. Rosa trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su familia y a su segundo hijo quien está preparándose para ingresar a la universidad y también para mantener su establecimiento comercial que es el principal ingreso económico de la familia, por ello la socia está solicitando el préstamo, para comprar mercadería como mochilas, camisetas, gorros y buzos deportivos, por ello está muy agradecida con  KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer y hacer crecer su actividad económica. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC SONCCO”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Rosa is married and has 3 children. She continues to sell backpacks and sporting gear at one of the city´s leading fairs. Rosa works hard to provide for her family and for her second son, who is getting ready to go to college, and to maintain her business, which is her family´s main source of income. So, she is applying for a loan to buy merchandise such as backpacks, shirts, caps, and diving gear. She thanks Kiva for helping her strengthen and grow her business. She belongs to the communal bank “SUMAC SONCCO” in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, shirts, caps, and diving gear.

loans.name: Dúo Bendición De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bendición de San Mateo 
Este dúo está Conformado por doña María Catalina, tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de arveja y ejote junto a su esposo, ella tiene 3 hijos, que están estudiando en la escuela de san Mateo Milpas altas un lugar cercano a la antigua Guatemala, ella está solicitando el crédito para invertir en compra de semillas y abono para la siembra de arveja y ejote, principalmente en la compra de abono y foliar para preparar sus plantas y así tener una buena cosecha ella nos menciona que lo que ella y su esposo anhelan es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sobre todo apoyarlos ya que ellos no tuvieron esa oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Dúo Bendición de San Mateo

This duo includes 32 year old María Catalina, who raises peas and green beans along with her husband.  She has three children who attend the San Mateo Milpas school, located in a place near old Guatemala.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops so that she can have a good harvest.  She says that she and her husband yearn for their children to finish school and above all they want to support them because they didn’t have the opportunity to go to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Flor De Habitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABITAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de frutas, carnicería, producción de golosinas, costura de centros, venta de queso, venta de faldas y costuras, tienda de barrio, venta de jugo de quinua,  macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de carnicería; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años aprendiendo hace años aprendiendo el mismo por medio de su madrina que tenía el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de la distribuidora de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la reunión con las socias.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo el esposo de la señora Santuza, mismo que se encuentra parado y tienen una gorra blanca
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE HABITAS” communal bank will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is made up of ten female members and is directed by a board of directors of which Martha is the President. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied and include: selling fruit, a butchers, producing sweets, sewing centrepieces, selling cheese, selling skirts and dressmaking, a local shop, selling quinoa juice and making macramé blankets. 

The loan which they will receive will benefit the small businesswomen, including Martha who has been in Pro Mujer for two years. She entered the scheme on invitation by a promoter of the institution who went to visit her in her home. She currently has a butchers shop, and she says that she started up the business years ago, learning the trade from her godmother who had the same business. 
 
The loan which she will now receive is to increase her capital (purchase of meat) which she will acquire from a distributor in the city of El Alto and which she will later sell in her shop. This way of working allows her to generate resources with which she can support her family as much as possible. She is married with two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the meetings with her fellow members. 

In the photograph Mrs Santuza's husband who is wearing a white cap and is currently unemployed accompanies the group.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos desde Perú les presento al Grupo “Las Talentosas” conformado por 07 socios, la cual pasan a su 7mo ciclo, siendo la gran  mayoría vecinos de la zona, grupo entusiasta que buscar mejorar cada día con el único fin de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias este es el caso de Dora la cual se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas típicas de la selva, este negocio lo realiza a repartos. A sus 69 Dora ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus metas como terminar de construir su vivienda y  mantener su negocio. El crédito que solicito lo destinara para la compra de insumos y asía poder preparar sus comidas. Su mayor deseo es de poner una tienda en su vivienda, pues esto le generaría mayores ganancias. Dora es separada y tiene 04 hijos independientes. Ella  es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste compa color celeste y pantalón azul.  En la parte superior esta la fotografía del señor Rómulo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. I introduce the group "Las Talentosas" [The Talented] formed by seven members, who are in their 7th cycle. Most of them are neighbors in the area. They are an enthusiastic group that seeks to improve every day with the goal to give a better quality of life to their families. 

This is the case of Dora, who is engaged in the preparation and sale of typical foods from the forest. She does this business by distributing. At her 69 years old, Dora has met some of her goals such as to finish building her home and to maintain her business. 

The loan she requested will be used to buy supplies so she can prepare her foods. Her greatest desire is to start a store in her home, because that would generate higher profits for her. Dora is separated and has four independent children. 

She is the second one from the right, she wears a light blue sweater and blue pants. At the top, there's the photograph of Rómulo.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: La socia es la señora María Elizabeth, casada y con 5 hijos, ella continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de productos de belleza por catalogo y es con esta actividad con la cual sacó adelante a toda su familia y educó a sus hijos, la socia distribuye artículos como perfumería y cosméticos a sus clientes de forma directa. María Elizabeth está solicitando su préstamo para comprar mercadería como perfumes para cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes, por ello está muy agradecida con  KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer y hacer crecer su actividad económica. La socia se compromete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, ella pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC SONCCO”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Our member is María Elizabeth, who is married and has 5 children. She continues to work selling beauty products by catalogue and it is with this activity that she was able to give her family a good start in life and educate her children. She distributes items such as perfume and cosmetics to her clients directly. María Elizabeth is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes to meet her clients' orders. She is very grateful to KIVA for helping her to strengthen her business and to make it grow. She promises to honour her loan repayments punctually. She belongs to the “SUMAC SONCCO” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is 23 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops for more than five years, earning about $3 per day. Her husband is a barber who earns about $10 daily. 

Randa is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for hiring farm workers to cultivate her crops. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.  Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to pay for hiring farm workers to cultivate her crops

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en  casa de familiares ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de diez horas al día en su peluquería y también los fines de semana ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más productos de peluquería (tintes, shampoo, acondicionadores) para uso del salón y para la venta a sus clientes  y aumentar sus ingresos ya que es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Aydee es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Aydee is single and has no children.  She lives in a relative's house, occupying three rooms.  The house is located in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Aydee currently earns an income by working more than 10 hours a day in her beauty salon, including weekends, because this is the only source of income she has to cover her family's expenses for food, education and basic services.  

She needs a loan to buy more beauty products for her salon (dyes, shampoo, conditioners), and to sell to her customers.  This way she can increase her income, which is the only source of income she has to support her family.

Aydee's dream is to increase her income so that she could live independently and have greater comfort, improving her quality of life.

This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoos and conditioners for use in her beauty salon, and to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: AURELIA TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UNA MUJER CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS. ELLA TRABAJA EN UN LABORATORIO COMO ENCARGADA DEL AREA DE LIMPIEZA. SU ESPOSO ES EMPLEADO EN UNA FABRICA DE LA CIUDAD. AMBOS APORTAN ECONOMICAMENTE PARA CUBRIR LAS NECESIDADES DE SU HOGAR, YA QUE ELLOS TIENE EL DESEO DE MEJORAR SU HOGAR Y LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SUS HIJOS. ACTUALMENTE AURELIA TIENE EL DESEO DE PODER DAR UNA NUEVA IMAGEN A SU CASA, POR ESTE MOTIVO DESEA PODER PINTAR SU CASA POR DENTRO Y POR FUERA CON EL PROPOSITO DE MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA. PARA ESTO ELLOS SOLICITAN EL PRESTAMO PARA LLEVAR ACABO DICHO PROYECTO.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 40 years old, married and has three children. She works in a laboratory and is in charge of maintenance. Her husband is employed in a factory in the city. Both contribute economically to cover household expenses because they want to improve their home and their children’s quality of life.

Currently, Aurelia would like to be able to give her house a new image. Consequently she wants to paint it inside and out with the goal of improving her residence. Consequently she and her husband are requesting a loan in order to carry out this project.

loans.use: to paint her house inside and out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean his fields and prepare them to be able to grow more coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more lotions, perfumes, and food supplement to resell

loans.name: David Lorenzo

texts.es: David Lorenzo ha trabajado durante muchos años con el café, pues fue su padre quien le enseñó todo lo relacionado con la producción de esta planta. Actualmente David Lorenzo tiene 58 años, una esposa y 8 hijos a quienes les ha enseñado, al igual que lo hizo su padre, a trabajar en el campo para ganarse la vida de forma honesta y también es empleado de un beneficio e café, actividad que le ayuda a tener ingresos durante los meses en que apenas están floreciendo sus matas de café. La meta principal de David Lorenzo como cafeticultor es tener más plantas sembradas en los próximos meses, pues actualmente tiene un promedio de 1,600 plantas por hectárea y en base a su experiencia sabe que puede llegar a tener hasta 2,000 plantas por hectárea sin que esto afecte la calidad del café que produce y por eso el necesita un crédito. Las plantas que sembrará ahora le estarán dando frutos en 3 años pero con la producción de su próxima cosecha podrá obtener el recurso necesario para pagar su crédito. Él sabe que si invierte de manera correcta su dinero dentro de poco tiempo obtendrá ganancias las cuales le servirán para hacer crecer sus actividades alternas, lo cual se verá reflejado en un mejor estilo de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
David Lorenzo has worked with coffee for many years.  It was his father who taught him everything related to the production of this plant.  Currently, David Lorenzo is a 58 year old man with a wife and eight children whom he has taught, as his father taught him, to work in the fields as a means of making an honest living.  He also works at a café which allows him to make money during the months when the plants are just beginning to grow.   

As a coffee farmer, David Lorenzo's main goal is to plant more coffee in the coming months.  He currently has about 1,600 plants per hectare but his experience has taught him that one can have up to 2,000 plants per hectare without affecting the quality of the coffee.  This is why he needs a loan.  

The coffee he will plant this season will bare fruit in three years but with the production of this next harvest he will make enough money to repay the loan.  He knows that if he makes the right investments his money will grow and he will be able to expand his other activities.  This will all be reflected in the improved lifestyle for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dúo Sagrado Corazón Group

texts.es:
DUO SAGRADO CORAZON
Dominga se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ella vive en una colonia llamada San Francisco 1.  Su negocio es una tortillería y esta ubicada en la orilla de la carretera principal de la aldea. Ella tiene dos trabajadoras y es una mujer muy emprendedora. tiene 3 hijos y  todos van a la escuela, su esposo  la ayuda en todo. Él también es comerciante,  Ella tiene muchos clientes que le compran tortillas y siempre la visitan ya que ella tortea en la mañana para vender en el desayuno, al medio día  y por la noche.  Ella esta muy necesitada de un préstamo ya que nececita invertir mas en su negocio, ella desea comprar el maíz por varios quintales para que le dejen un buen precio y así ella sacar más ganancia en las ventas.  Por mas de 10 años ella se ha dedicado a la tortillería espera que en está oportunidad le puedan atorgar el credito solicitado ya que lo necesita para la compra de maíz para la elavoracion de tortillas.
texts.en:
DUO SAGRADO CORAZON
Dominga works selling tortillas. She lives in a settlement called San Francisco 1. Her tortilla shop is located on the edge of the main road of the village. She has two employees and is a very enterprising woman. She has three children who each attend school, and her husband helps her with everything. She has many customers who buy tortillas from her. They always visit her because she begins making her tortillas early in the morning to sell with breakfast, as well as in the afternoon and at night. She is in need of a loan because she wishes to invest more in her business and she hopes to buy various bushels of corn so that she gets a bulk price. This will lead to better earnings with her sales. For more than 10 years now she has made tortillas, and she hopes to be granted this opportunity to receive a loan because she needs to buy corn in order to keep producing tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase corn for the preparation of tortillas.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan y para venderlos en las ferias que se realizan los fines de semana, la socia a la vez continua  alquilando su carro  para brindar el  servicio de taxi ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su carro.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” (Solidarity-Cachimayo) Communal Bank. She keeps on engaging in selling small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and pigs. She breeds these animals to then sell them in the fairs that take place during the weekends. She also continue renting out her car to offer a taxi service, an activity she has been engaging in for a good time, and things are going well thanks to the dedication she daily works with.

She is requesting a loan to buy tires for her car.

She feels grateful for the loan she has received and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy tires for her car.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
Bonifacia, de 51 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora.  Es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene 01 hijo ya mayor e independiente. Tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja y ahí dieron educación y una buena crianza a su hijo quien ahora apoya en muchos gastos en la economía de su hogar.

El trabajo de Bonifacia consiste en la compra de bebidas gasificadas al por mayor, tiene un espacio acondicionado en  su casa en donde realiza la venta y también  vende al menudeo ganando su porcentaje por venta a sobrecosto ya que ella los vende helado, además ella tiene algunas cosas más en venta, entre ellos panecillos y kekes caseros con los que sus clientes comen como antojos.  
Lleva más de  09 años trabajando en éste negocio y lo hace sola ya que su pareja se dedica a otras actividades.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo ya que tiene tiempo para poder hacer las actividades en su hogar, tiene buenos clientes y le va bien ya que gana buen porcentaje de sus ventas. Por tanto, espera poder en el futuro poner una fuente de soda para que así puede seguir creciendo en lo económico. Este es el préstamo número 17 con la institución MFP, felizmente le esta yendo bien en todo y espera poder seguir siendo cumplida como lo ha sido hasta ahora, esta muy agradecida ya que gracias a los prestamos obtenidos pudo aumentar su capital y tener mejores ingresos. Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará  bebidas gasificadas en mayor volumen, entre ellas gaseosas en envase de vidrio y en envases descartables, con esto tendrá mayor cantidad de mercadería en stock y se evitará estar gastando en pasajes a diarios para hacer sus compras.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is 51 years old. She is a happy and very hardworking woman. She lives with her partner, with whom she has one child who is already grown and independent. She has her own house where she lives alongside her partner, and there they educated and raised their child, who now supports them with many of their household expenses. 

Bonifacia works purchasing soft drinks in bulk. She has an air-conditioned space in her house where she makes the sales. She also sells retail, earning her percentage by selling above her cost to purchase, since she sells them ice-cold. In addition, she has some other items that she sells, among them homemade breads and cakes that her customers crave. 

She has been working in this business for more than 9 years, and she does it alone, since her partner works at other activities. She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand that she has and the good earnings that it gives her. 

She enjoys her work, as she has time to do her household activities. She has good customers and it goes well for her, since she is able to save a good portion of her sales. Therefore, she hopes in the future to install a soda fountain so she will be able to continue growing economically. 

This is loan number 17 with the organization MFP; happily, everything is going well for her and she hopes to continue to be compliant as she has been up to now. She is very grateful, because thanks to the loans, she was able to increase her capital and have more income. With the requested loan of 4000 soles, she will purchase a greater volume of soft drinks, including sodas in glass bottles and disposable cups. With this, she will have a greater quantity of merchandise in stock, and she will avoid having to spend on daily trips to make her purchases.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and disposable cups.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De San Martin Group

texts.es:
Dúo las Victoria de San Martin,
Este Dúo está integrado por la señora Victoria, de 49 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de Calzado desde hace 5 años, vende distintos diseños  y tamaños  de calzado ya que es de esta forma como ella ayuda económicamente a su familia, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de Calzado en diferentes diseños ya que sus clientes le solicitan nuevos estilos, y necesita surtirles para satisfacer sus necesidades espera que Kiva le pueda ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria belongs to the Dúo las Victoria de San Martin group. She is 49 years old and has three children. She has been selling shoes for five years and sells different designs and sizes of footwear because that is how she helps her family economically. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase shoes in different designs because her customers have asked her for new styles and she needs to stock up to fill their orders. 

She hopes that Kiva can help her with funding.

loans.use: to purchase shoes in different designs.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Primavera De 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA 27 DE MAYO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en cama y aguayos, venta de comida, tejido de chompas y mantas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que es a primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, iniciando el mismo solo con la venta de gelatinas posteriormente fue incrementando su capital y abrió su tienda.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar, fideo, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The group “PRIMAVERA 27 DE MAYO” (Spring May 27th) will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada.  It is made up of six members and it is governed by a board, of which Lidia is the President.  The businesses that the members of the association manage are varied and include: food sales, crafting artisanal beds and aguayos (traditional multi-purpose rectangular cloths), weaving sweaters and blankets, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they are requesting will benefit the small business group of which Lidia is a member.  She indicates that this is her first time working with ProMujer, and that she joined at the invitation of a promoter of the organization that came to her home to visit her.  Currently, she has a neighborhood store, and she has been working at this business for years, starting out selling only gelatin, and then increasing her capital and opening her store.

The loan that she is currently taking out is to increase her capital (purchasing sugar, noodles, oil, etc.) which she will acquire in the markets of the city of El Alto and then sell in her store.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.

When consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the trainings about health and the loans.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jhon Henrry

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Jhon, casado, tiene 33 años de edad y un hijo de 5 años, él se dedica al rubro de la construcción civil y es con esta actividad sacrificada que saca adelante a su familia.  Jhon está solicitando el préstamo para comprar herramientas como algunas maquinas herramientas, que le faciliten el proceso de su trabajo.
Jhon está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad y permitirle llevar el sustento a su familia. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Jhon is 33 years old, he is married and he has a 5-year-old child. He works in constructions and he provides for his family thanks to this demanding activity. Jhon is requesting a loan to buy items such as a few machine tools in order to ease up this working process.
Jhon is deeply grateful to KIVA’s help, as this helps him with his activity thus allowing him to provide for his family. He is a member of “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca Temple), a Communal Bank of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy a few machine tools.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe es un productor de café desde hace varios años. También es trabajador en un beneficio de café y se encarga de la reparación de vehículos y maquinaria. Durante la época de cosecha Felipe contrata cortadores para que hagan las labores necesarias en su terreno y dentro de dos meses comenzará nuevamente la cosecha en la región donde vive por lo que está solicitando un crédito para poder pagar a los cortadores de café que contratará. Felipe y su esposa Teresa también se dedican a la venta de quesos pues tienen algunas vacas lo cual les genera un ingreso extra para la familia. Pasando la cosecha Felipe nos comentó que le gustaría hacer algunas mejoras en su casa para vivir de manera más cómoda con su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Felipe has been a coffee producer for several years.  He is also an employee of a coffee company, where he is in charge of repairing vehicles and machinery.  During the harvest season, he hires laborers to do the necessary work on his land.  Within two months he will begin harvesting again in the region where he lives. He is seeking a loan in order to pay these laborers.

To generate extra income for the family, he and his wife Teresa also sell cheeses, since they have a number of cows.  He told us that he would like to make some improvements to his home so that he and his wife and son can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting of coffee.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual de 51 años, está casado con Esther, con quien tiene 2 hijos, pero ya no viven con él. Pascual y su esposa viven juntos en una casa propia que les tomó muchos años construir. Pascual es un hombre carismático y sencillo. Se dedica a la compostura y confección de prendas de vestir.
Lleva como 10 años en este negocio. Empezó alquilando un pequeño local, con una máquina de coser. Actualmente cuenta con 3 máquinas y trabajan junto a él, su esposo y su nuera. “Estos días tenemos mucho trabajo, por el aniversario de la provincia, por eso nos mandan confeccionar disfraces, banderolas, y otras cosas”, menciona.
Además dice, que los meses: enero, febrero y marzo, el negocio no rinde bien, pero los meses consecuentes son mejores.
Las principales necesidades dentro de su labor, son materiales de compostura, como hilos y agujas. Luego telas de distintas calidades. Por ello está vez requiere de su ayuda, para adquirir los que le hace falta. Éste es su préstamo número 2 con MFP. Dice estar contento con su banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Capelo”, por ser socios unidos. 
Con el dinero podrá adquirir conos de hilos de diferentes colores y telas para realizar sus composturas y confecciones.
texts.en:
Pascual is 51 years old, he is married with Esther and they have 2 children who do not live with them. Pascual and his wife live in their own house, and it took them many years to build it. Pascual is a simple and charismatic man who engages in repairing and making clothes.
He has been engaging in this activity for 10 years. He has started by renting out a small locale and with a sewing machine. He currently has 3 machines and works together with his wife and his daughter-in-law. He says: “As we are celebrating the anniversary of the province, we are working a lot these days, as we are asked to make costumes, flags and other items”.
He also says that January, February and March are the months in which his activity does not give good results, but the other mother are better.
What he needs the most for his job are mending materials such as threads and needles, as well as different types of fabric. For this reason he needs your help this time in order to buy what he lacks. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he says he is happy about his Communal Bank, “Los Pioneros de Capelo” (Capelo’s Pioneers) as its members are close-knit.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cones of threads in different colors to do his repairs and make his creations.

loans.use: To buy fabric and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Sumac Wata Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SUMAC WATA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Sonia tiene 49 años de edad ,02 hijos y es casada, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como colonias, perfumes, cremas entre otros, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus amistades y familiares, que le solicitan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como perfumes y colonias.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de repuestos y trabajadores de instituciones privada y pública.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Introducing Sonia, a member of Sumac Wata, a Communal Bank located in Wanchaq, a district in the province and department of Cusco.

Sonia is 49 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with her retailing activity, selling beauty products such as colognes, perfumes and creams. She sells her products door to door to her friends and relatives who place orders with her. She has been engaging in this activity for a few years and things are going well thanks to the dedication she daily works with. She is a responsible and diligent person, and through her activity she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as perfumes and colognes.

The other members of the group engage in selling fruits, selling food, selling clothes, selling spare parts and in working in private and public institutions.

Sonia feels deeply grateful for the loan she has received and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken eggs to sell

loans.name: José Maximiliano

texts.es: José Maximiliano agricultor y empleado de un beneficio de café donde está encargado de realizar maniobras de carga y envasado. José Maximiliano tiene 38 años de edad vive con su esposa Minerva y 3 hijos, es productor de café convencional tiene interés en cambiarse a café orgánico, esta dispuesto a recibir asistencia técnica y a seguir las instrucciones por parte de los técnicos de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para lograr dicho cambio. Para José Maximiliano es muy importante aumentar y mejorar su producción de café ya que es su actividad laboral principal, la mayor parte de las fincas fueron heredadas por una padre las demás fueron compradas producto de la venta del café. Sus metas a mediano y largo plazo son renovar las plantas viejas con nuevas y así aumentar su producción, por tal motivo pide un crédito para la compra de plantas para resiembra y para labores culturales donde le ayudaran a marcar su parcela y a sembrar las plantas aumentando su producción y mejorando la calidad de su café el podrá aumentar su calidad de vida y así poder cumplir su mayor ilusión la cual es que sus hijos sean profesionistas pero sin olvidar el trabajo de campo ya que las parcelas que hoy posee serán su herencia en el futuro.
texts.en:
José Maximiliano is a farmer and employed by a coffee plantation where he is responsible for freight and loading tasks. He is 38 years old and lives with his wife, Minerva, and three children. 

José Maximiliano produces conventional coffee and is interested in changing to organic coffee. He is ready to receive technical assistance and follow the instructions from the technicians at the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” (Huatusco Regional Union) in order to make that change. For José Maximiliano it is very important to increase and improve his coffee production because it is his main labor activity. Most of his land was inherited from a parent and the rest was bought from his coffee sales. 

His medium and long term goals are to replace his old plants with new ones and thus increase production. Consequently he is requesting a loan in order to purchase plants to re-sow and for technical work where they help him to stake his land and plant his crop. By increasing production and improving the quality of his coffee he will be able to increase his quality of life. Consequently he will be able to fulfill his greatest dream, which is that his children become professionals, but without ever forgetting work in the fields because the plots of land that he owns today will be their inheritance in the future.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants to re-seed his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Las Estrellas De 3J Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE 3J” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de joyas, venta de cerveza, venta de busos, venta de enaguas, venta de lavadores de plástico, venta de fruta y pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de joyas, ella cuenta que inicio esta actividad hace años cuando ayudaba a sus padres en este oficio, posteriormente ella estableció su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de oro) que comprará de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las personas solicitantes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The community bank "Estrellas de 3J", is starting its first loan cycle with the regional office Pro Mujer in Juan Pablo.  The group is comprised of six members and is overseen by a board of directors, of which Verónica is the president.

The members are engaged in various business, including the sale of jewelry, beer, sweatshirts, coats, and cleaning tools, as well as fruits and vegetables.This loan will benefit these small microbusinesses. 

Verónica reports that this is the group's first time working with Pro Mujer.  She was invited to work with them by a friend who works for the institution.   Currently she has a business selling jewelry.  She says that she began selling jewelry years ago in order to help her parents.  She later established her own business.

She will use her portion of the loan proceeds to purchase gold at wholesale and to make jewelry to order for her customers.  This form of work will enable her to generate resources to support her family to the greatest extent possible.  She lives with her common-law husband and their son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she reported that she likes the training in the areas of health and finances.

loans.use: to buy gold.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Mujeres de Esperanza está conformado por 8 socias que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, lugar que es muy visitado por sus aguas termales, su gastronomía típica y sus varios centros de atracción turística. Su gente es amable, gentil y de un gran carisma como las socias de este banco comunal quienes trabajan arduamente para mejorar su estabilidad económica para sacar adelante a sus familias, muchas son comerciantes, algunas se dedican a la crianza de animales y también trabajan como empleadas privadas.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Nieves, está conformando el banco comunal Mujeres de Esperanza hace 7 meses y se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito, tiene 36 años de edad, está separada de su marido pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 17, 13, 11, 6 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de apenas 2 meses de edad, su primer hijo trabaja, le ayuda económicamente y estudia en un colegio por la noche, sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en el colegio y su cuarto hijo está en una escuelita de la localidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Rosa Nieves se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo actividad que la desempeña hace un año, en casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos los que vende pelados o en pie.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos ya que le va muy bien en la venta de estos animalitos.
 
Su  sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mujeres de Esperanza (Women of Hope) is a group composed of 8 members who live in the outskirts of Baños en Cuenca, a hamlet greatly visited for its thermal waters, its typical gastronomy and its different tourist attractions. Its inhabitants are kind and gentle, and with a great charisma just like the members of this Communal Bank, who work hard to improve their economic stability ad provide for their families. Many of them are retailers, some engage in animal breeding and some are employees in private companies.

Rosa Nieves is one of the members of this group. She has been a member of Mujeres de Esperanza for 7 months and she is now working her second cycle. She is 36 years old she is separated from her husband but she has 5 children with him, aged 17, 13, 11, 6 and 2 months. Her eldest child has a job and he economically supports her while going to school in the evenings; her second and third child go to high school and her fourth child attends a small school of their community. She does not have a house of her own, so she has to rent the one she lives in.

Rosa Nieves has been selling cosmetics by catalogue for one year, on top of breeding chickens in her house to sell them either live or butchered.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy chickens, as this selling activity in going very well for her.

She dreams of having a house of her own.

loans.use: Comprar pollos.

loans.name: Humbertina De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Humbertina forma parte hace 10 años del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que esta bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su Centro Histórico es una mezcla de la arquitectura colonial y la arquitectura moderna, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su vestimenta es muy colorida la cual le regala color y alegría a la ciudad.

Doña Humbertina tiene 64 años de edad, es separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y están casados. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad siendo el fruto de su trabajo.

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cómo pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que la desempeña desde que saco su primer crédito en la banca comunal.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para estos animales para seguir creciendo en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es tener más galpones de pollos para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Humbertina has been a member of La Paz Communal Bank for 10 years.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by four rivers, giving it the name Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.  Since December 1999 it has been a World Heritage Site.  Its historic center has a mix of colonial and modern architecture.  The people there preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.  The clothing is very colorful, which gives the city color and happiness.

Humbertina, 64, is separated from her husband and has two adult children who are married.  The house in which she lives is her own property and the fruit of her labor.

She works taking care of the home, and as she spends most of her time there she raises chickens, a job she has done since she got her first loan with the communal bank.

She's going to invest her new loan in buying chickens and chicken feed to continue growing in her business.

Her goal is to have more sheds to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes from AVON

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken to sell

loans.name: Altiplano Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTIPLANO” iniciará el decimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Caciana es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de galletas, costura de centros, venta de queso, venta de faldas y costuras, tienda de barrio, venta de jugo de quinua,  venta de frutas, carnicería, macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Caciana es una integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos, ella cuenta que inicio esta actividad hace años cuando le invitaron a pertenecer la venta de productos cosméticos los cuales le generaron ganancia y se estableció en ese negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará a las personas solicitantes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Antiplano" will start its 10th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Hub of Villa Exaltación. It's composed of 11 members and is headed by a board where Caciana is the Treasurer. The businesses that members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among them there are: production of cookies, seam centers, sale of cheese, sale of skirts and seams, corner store, sale of quinoa juice, sale of fruits, butcher's shop, and macramé blankets.

The loan they will obtain will benefit small microenterprises where Caciana is a member.
